channel.title: [317] Trying to change XP rate but no config or client java files
channel.description:
I'm attempting to edit the XP rate for my 317 server and the only file I found that held this information was Constants.java
I edited the EXP_RATE value there, saved, compiled, and switched the Constants.class file out with the previous one. The server loaded up fine with no errors, but the XP rate was still right as it was before I changed it.
I've looked at several tutorials and they all reference a "config.java" or "client.java" file that needs to be edited, however no such file exists in my server source. The only place where I can find the string "EXP" is in Constants.java, so naturally I went to edit it.
This is quite confusing as there are no errors showing up and I don't know what could be wrong. Even when I view the Constants.class file with jd-gui, it shows the edited EXP_RATE that I put in, but on the server it's still different. This leads me to believe something else must be telling the server to override or keep the XP at it's original value, but I couldn't find any other files like this through the file search function...
If anyone has a clue to what it could be or where I should look to edit, please tell me. I've been solving error after error on my own but now I don't have a hint as to what is missing or wrong.
Thanks.

item.title: [317] Trying to change XP rate but no config or client java files
item.dc:creator: @Zark Zark
item.description:
@Zark wrote:

Issue has been resolved.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Trying to change XP rate but no config or client java files
item.dc:creator: @heatrn11 heatrn11
item.description:
@heatrn11 wrote:

[quote=“Zark, post:3, topic:537714”][quote author=ky sorcerer link=topic=656539.msg4393104#msg4393104 date=1388216186]
Source >Src>config.java>scroll down, you will see the exp rates.
Hope this helped
[/quote]

If you read my post, you would have seen that config.java does not exist inside my server source. How am I supposed to edit a file that isn’t there…[/quote]

Not all servers are packaged exactly the same…What base are you using exactly?

Read full topic
